blocks.data:
Lists all order coupons. Optional parameters can be passed in.

|Type `int`|Type Name|
|-|-|
|`0`|`per_item_discount`|
|`1`|`percentage_discount`|
|`2`|`per_total_discount`|
|`3`|`shipping_discount`|
|`4`|`free_shipping`|
|`5`|`promotion`|

### OAuth Scopes
|  **UI Name** | **Permission** | **Parameter** |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  Orders | modify | `store_v2_orders` |
|  Orders | read-only | `store_v2_orders_read_only` |

### Headers

|Header|Parameter|Description|
|-|-|-|
|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token `|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

### Example

```http
GET /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/catalog/summary
host: api.bigcommerce.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-Auth-Token: {access_token}
```

* For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).
* **Name**: X-Auth-Token
* **Location**: header

page.description: The page to return in the response.

id.description: Numeric ID of the coupon code.

coupon_id.description: Numeric ID of the associated coupon.

order_id.description: Numeric ID of the associated order.

amount.description: Amount of the discount. This information is returned as in integer. Dollar and percentage discounts will return the same. For example, $3 returns as '3' while 5% will return as 5. Check the discount type to see what type of discount is available.

type.title: Order Coupon Discount Type
type.description:
0: per_item_discount
1: percentage_discount
2: per_total_discount
3: shipping_discount
4: free_shipping
5: promotions

discount.description:
The amount off the order the discount is worth. For example, if an order subtotal is $90 and the discount is $3 then it will return as 3.000. If the discount is
3% then will return as 2.7000 or the amount of the order.  (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)
